text: Indonesia participated in the 1994 Asian Games held in the city of Hiroshima, Japan from 2 October to 16 October 1994. It ranked eleventh in medal count, with three gold medals, 12 silver medals, and 11 bronze medals in this edition of the Asiad. ==Medal summary== ===Medal table=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text-align:center;" ! width=180|Sport !scope="col" style="background:gold; width:55px;"|Gold !scope="col" style="background:silver; width:55px;"|Silver !scope="col" style="background:#cc9966; width:55px;"|Bronze ! width=55|Total |- |align=left| Badminton || 3 || 2 || 2 || 7 |- |align=left| Karate || 0 || 3 || 2 || 5 |- |align=left| Tennis || 0 || 2 || 3 || 5 |- |align=left| Taekwondo || 0 || 2 || 1 || 3 |- |align=left| Weightlifting || 0 || 1 || 1 || 2 |- |align=left| Archery || 0 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- |align=left| Bowling || 0 || 1 || 0 || 1 |- |align=left| Boxing || 0 || 0 || 2 || 2 |-class="sortbottom" !Total || 3 || 12 || 11 || 26 |} ===Medalists=== {| class="wikitable sortable" style="font-size:90%" |- !
